title: Girl, 10, 'begged Snapchat pedophile to stop as he held her down and raped her'
text:
Austin Altman reportedly groomed a 10 year-old girl on Snapchat, picked her up from her parents’ house and then drove her to his home where he raped her (Pictures: Land O’ Lakes Sheriff’s Office/Getty)

A 10 year-old girl begged a pedophile she met on Snapchat to stop as he held her down and raped her, police say.

Austin Altman, 22, is said to have attacked the youngster after picking her up from her home in Hernando County, Florida, on Saturday night.

Altman reportedly drove to the girl’s home and picked her up without her parents knowing, then took her back to his house in nearby Spring Hill.

Her family raised the alarm on finding her missing at 6:40am, with the youngster’s friends saying she’d made friends with a man who drove a red pickup truck.

The girl is said to have told them that she planned to run away with its driver.

Wyatt is being held at Land O’ Lakes Detention center without bond after being charged with child rape and violating probation related to an earlier offense (Picture: Google Maps)

Deputies from Hernando County Sheriff’s Office were able to track Altman down at his home, WFLA reported.

He reportedly denied knowing anything about the missing girl – but moments later detectives found the stricken youngster in his bedroom.

She told deputies that Altman had forced her to have sex with him while holding her down by the throat and ignoring her pleas with him to stop.

During a subsequent police interview, Altman reportedly admitted meeting the girl over Snapchat, picking her up and raping her.

He now faces child rape charges, and is being held at Land O’ Lakes Detention Center without bond ahead of his next court appearance.

Austin also faces a further charge of violating probation after being arrested on a felony forced entry charge in September 2018.
description: Austin Wyatt, of Spring Hill in Florida, reportedly groomed the girl and asked if she'd like to run away with him - then raped her
